title: How to Make Chai Tea Squares

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: Prepare the baking pan by greasing or lining with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients from oatmeal to brown sugar in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Mix together well using a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Pour in the chai concentrate or tea, milk, applesauce, vinegar, vanilla extract, and coconut.
Pour the batter into the baking pan.
Place in the pre-warmed oven.
steps.description: Bake for 25 minutes, or until a skewer or toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool for a few minutes, then cut into squares and serve immediately. It is best served warm; add butter for a rich melted additional flavor. If served cold, add chai or maple flavored frosting.

text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the baking pan by greasing or lining with parchment paper. Add the dry ingredients from oatmeal to brown sugar in a large mixing bowl. Mix together well using a wooden spoon. Pour in the chai concentrate or tea, milk, applesauce, vinegar, vanilla extract, and coconut. Mix through thoroughly. Pour the batter into the baking pan.  Place in the pre-warmed oven. Bake for 25 minutes, or until a skewer or toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Remove from the oven. Allow to cool for a few minutes, then cut into squares and serve immediately. It is best served warm; add butter for a rich melted additional flavor. If served cold, add chai or maple flavored frosting. Finished.
